conclusion: Trace the path of liquid from points A, B, C, and D to determine which container it will flow into.
Point A: Liquid flows downward and encounters the first baffle (black).
Black baffle deflects liquid to the right.
After black baffle, liquid continues downward and encounters the second baffle (white).
White baffle deflects liquid further to the right.
Liquid flows downward and enters container F.
Point B: Liquid flows downward and encounters the first baffle (brown).
Brown baffle deflects liquid to the left.
Liquid continues downward and encounters the second baffle (purple).
Purple baffle deflects liquid further to the left.
Liquid flows downward and enters container E.
Point C: Liquid flows downward and encounters the first baffle (yellow).
Yellow baffle deflects liquid to the right.
Liquid continues downward and encounters the second baffle (orange).
Orange baffle deflects liquid further to the right.
Liquid flows downward and enters container G.
Point D: Liquid flows downward and encounters the first baffle (blue).
Blue baffle deflects liquid to the right.
Liquid continues downward and encounters the second baffle (gray).
Gray baffle deflects liquid further to the right.
Liquid flows downward and enters container G.
Summarize final containers: Point A to F, Point B to E, Points C and D to G.
Final answer: Liquid from A to F, B to E, C and D to G.
